page.title: 19ITCHINGFIELD
page.content: {ITCHINGFIELD }IS A UNIQUE HAMLET CONTAINING A CHURCH,SCHOOL,SCATTERED HOUSES AND FARMS_BUT NO SHOPS.THE NAME IS DERIVED FROM THE SAXON:{ECEN}_GREAT AND{FELD}_A FIELD.{THE CHURCH}OF ST. NICHOLAS IS THOUGHT TO DATE FROM 1125_ 1150.IT HAS A BELFRY TOWER WITHIN A SPIRE OF OAK SHINGLING.IN THE CHURCH_ YARD IS A MEDIEVAL PRIEST HOUSE WHERE IT IS THOUGHT THE TRAVELLING MONKS FROM SELE ABBEY WOULD HAVE STAYED WHILE CELEBRATING MASS AT THE CHURCH. NOWADAYS THE CHURCH SHARES A RECTOR WITH SLINFOLD PARISH AND IS IN A PERIOD OF INTERREGNUM.{ITCHINGFIELD {SCHOOL}WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1853 PRIMARILY FOR THE CHILDREN OF STAFF EMPLOYED AT THE BIG HOUSES,FARMERS & TRADESPEOPLE.IT WAS THEN ADEQUATE FOR A POPULATION OF 371,WITH ONLY 1 ROOM. TODAY IT HAS 140 PUPILS WITH A MODERN INFANTS DEPARTMENT AT BARNS GREEN.
